greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 1; for n > 1, a(n) = n/d for the least divisor d > 1 of n such that A048720(d,k) = n for some k.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences related to polynomials in ring GF(2)[X]
program: (PARI) A325641(n) = if(1==n,n, my(p = Pol(binary(n))*Mod(1, 2)); fordiv(n,d,if((d>1),my(q = Pol(binary(d))*Mod(1, 2)); if(0==(p%q), return(n/d)))));
xref: Cf. A325559 (positions of ones after the initial 1).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 11 2019
